title: firefox "screenshot" command line option
content:
in previous versions of firefox, I was able to create screenshots with the following command line options:

/firefox.exe" -P headless --purgecaches --screenshot raw_weather.png --window-size=1920,1080 -browser "https://www.google.com/search?&q=weather+in+Washington+DC"

however, with the latest version 92.0.1, the "--screenshot" option no longer works. what has changed? what am I doing wrong?

creator: alanbala

title: Last update
content:
That last update has rendered Firefox unusable for me and other visually impaired people by making the display screen incompatible with Windows accessibility options. The drop down menus are fine, it's the display screen that is now a white background only, instead of the accessible black background with light letters.

I realize this is likely clear as mud, but that white background is illegible to people with poor vision.

I want my browser back. If thee is a way to go back to an earlier build that worked, I'd like to know it. If there is a compensatory add on, I'd like to find it. If your developers have decided visually impaired adults are SOL I suppose that's useful, too.

TIA for any help.

--Warpster@msn.com
creator: Warpster

title: browser not working
content:
hello, I have been using firefox for years but over the past couple of weeks i keep getting an error message and it started with only a few sites at first but now its almost every site i try to reach. i can no longer work through firefox and have to bounce between browsers. I can't reach simple sites such as google sheets, drive, etc.

i've tried just about everything to try an fix it. I've downloaded adblockers, checked for viruses, tried multiple different wifis thinking maybe mine was the problem, downloaded antivirus software, cleaned out my computer of junk

its always the same error message or the site shows up white and in the wrong format. i couldn't even access this page on firefox, i'm on a different browser writing this.

this is the error message: Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to drive.google.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

title: Menu Bar & background colors
content: First of all know that I am a retired computer tech and have tried various ways to resolve this problem myself to no avail, maybe someone here can help me. Here is my quandary: When I update to the newer version (92.0.1) of Firefox on my Windows 10 Laptop it changes the background & Menu Bar to a white-ish/gray color and I cannot get my menu bar color back to the black background with white text that was in the 86.0.1 (64-bit) version. The bookmarks toolbar remains a white-ish/gray color & with the Menu bar the same color it all blends in and I do not like that. I would rather have the Menu bar remain as a black background with white text & the bookmarks toolbar remain the white-ish/gray color. Is there a way to change the colors back to what they were in the 86.0.1 version? I have currently uninstalled the 92.0.1 version and reinstalled the 86.0.1 version and that is what I am working with now. However, I keep getting a pop-up every once in awhile to upgrade to the newer version, which I deny because of the background color changes, and I have continually asked the support team to keep the color changes the same but have heard nothing back from them concerning this issue and when I try to change the colors back to their previous settings I cannot find the means to do so and I have tried to go into the themes/color options to no avail. Is there a way to keep the colors in the 92.0.1 version the same as they were in the 86.0.1 version? Thank you for your help in this matter.
creator: Aj4longer

title: Unable to extract text from spooled pdf files generated when a file is printed through Firefox browser on mac

PDF file is displayed properly but when we copy text from it and try to paste it somewhere then text is not correct. title: Youtube video pauses, audio continues
content: When playing a video pauses but the audio continues. The video will then continue but has jumped ahead to where the audio is. So, audio plays uninterrupted, but video will pause, resume, pause, resume multiple times and each time it resumes, it jumps ahead so it is synced with the audio. This occurs most often in Youtube videos. However, I've noticed it playing other videos when in the browser.
creator: smith.dennisw.jr

title: Firefox is redirecting to homepage or loading different languages every time I click a link on a site
content:
Hello,

I love Firefox, but lately it is driving me insane! Here is what happens:

Most of the websites I visit, if they have more that 1 language, Firefox loads different language when I load a new page on that site.

For Example: I go to prestashop.com and the site loads in Russian. Then I click Templates in the main menu, and the page is loaded in Polish. Then I click on Modules in the menu and that page is loaded in German. And this happens randomly, not every time.

Second problem: I try to open a product on some online store and it redirects me to the previous page I was in. I try to login in other site and when I click on the login button it redirects me to the previous page again. That happens on many sites I visit, but not all.

I tried cleaning the Cache, Cookies and etc - nothing changed. Reinstalled Firefox and logged with my profile, the problems are still there. If I do not log with my profile Firefox is working normally.

Is there a way to fix this and not by creating new profile, because I have a ton of bookmarks and logins that I don't want to loose?

This is not happening in private mode.
creator: service104

title: Firefox always removing cookies, regardless of settings
content: Firefox always deletes cookies for some websites when it's restarted. While working in non-private mode I checked, that the setting for removing the cookies on closing is set to off. Then I tried adding some websites to the exception list for this setting, no luck. I made sure that cookies on those websites are persistent, not session only, and they are working in other browsers. I tried disabling the plugins, but it didn't help either. It's somewhat annoying, because now I have to adjust cookie preferences every time I visit my favourite websites. I use "standard" protection settings.

title: You send me to pages in foreign languages
content:
You send me to pages in a foreign language. For example,I clicked LinkedIn, and it's in a foreign language.

When I click to go to a page often it's in a foreign language that I can't understand. I speak English. My only language setting is English.

Sometimes you send me that "Prove you're not a robot" that's all in characters like Chinese. I cannot understand it at all. I like Mozilla, but may have to use Google to get some work done.

Sometimes I use a VPN (Virtual Private Network) because I handle bills and finances online. Both myself and the IP address of the VPN are in the United States. I never do anything that involves foreign countries.
